comments:
I am using mylar 2.0M3 and eclipse 3.3M7

java.lang.AbstractMethodError: org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.core.AbstractRepositoryConnector.updateTaskFromTaskData(Lorg/eclipse/mylar/tasks/core/TaskRepository;Lorg/eclipse/mylar/tasks/core/AbstractRepositoryTask;Lorg/eclipse/mylar/tasks/core/RepositoryTaskData;Z)V
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.syncTask(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.run(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

ahum.. I think I was too quick in reporting this as a bug.
I have done another 'search for updates' because I thought perhaps it was dependent on something else, that needed an update. 
It seems that the update of mylar went wrong before, because it found new updates of mylar.
Now that these are installed I no longer have this error.

Therefore I set the status of this bug to Worksforme.
Thanks for noticing that.  This is in fact notorious bug 132450, please consider voting for it.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 132450 ***
